question_text: A technician replaces a 64-bit CPU with a 32-bit CPU. What system limitation will most likely occur?
answer_options: Unable to install a 32-bit operating system
Inability to use applications requiring more than 4GB of memory
Boot process will be faster due to lower instruction complexity
correct_answer: Inability to use applications requiring more than 4GB of memory
explanation: 32-bit CPUs are limited to addressing around 4GB of RAM, which restricts access to modern apps that require more memory.
